section.title: What are plugins?
section.p: Plugins are small jar files which extend the functionality of the core Jmol program. A full list of plugins can be found at the CDK Plugins website, which also explains where these plugins are installed.

Both Jmol $VERSION$ and Jmol 10 support plugins. The latter needs to be started as java -Dmodel=cdk -jar jmol.jar. The first cannot run all plugins though, e.g. the DirBrowser plugin does not work. The RSSViewer plugin does work in both versions.

section.title: Default Plugins
section.p: Jmol v10 by default includes the DirBrowser plugin.
